definitions.definition: a spoken description of an event that is given while it is happening, especially on the radio or television

examples.text: I was listening to the radio commentary on the game.
The station provided live commentary on the African Nations Cup.

definitions.definition: a written explanation or discussion of something such as a book or a play

examples.text: a critical commentary on the final speech of the play
The deleted scenes have an optional commentary by the director.
He wrote a commentary on Paul's Letters to the Romans.

definitions.definition: a criticism or discussion of something

examples.text: The petty quarrels were a sad commentary on the state of the government.
The movie is a biting commentary on contemporary life in a big city.
The novel provides a powerful social commentary on post-war Germany.
The film is part love story and part social commentary.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin commentarius, commentarium (adjective, used as a noun), from commentari, frequentative of comminisci ‘devise’.
